reviews.review: This game NEVER gets old! It's one of my all time favs.
good !

[h1]Gameplay: Fantastic
Controls: Very Good
Stability: Great
Graphics: Very Good
Difficulty: Very Good
Sounds: Great
Music: Good
Story: N/A[/h1]

Left 4 Dead is a zombie survival game where you play as 4 different survivors getting from point A to point B to escape whilst mowing down fast hordes of the undead and special zombie types along the way aswell as fending off of them for as long as possible in Survival mode or actaully playing as the zombie to prevent the survivors from completeing their goals.

[h1]PROS/CONS[/h1]
+ Playable online and offline
+ Play offline with up to 3 intelligent bots
+ Various weapons
+ 4 Interesting characters
+ Moddable (Not Workshop Compatible)
+ 3 Different gamemodes (Campaign, Survival, Versus)
+ Play as a zombie
- Bots cannot use grenades or mounted guns

[h1]CONCLUSION:[/h1]
Very fun to play espeically with friends. Versus mode is very well balanced for both teams.

[h1]RECCORMENDED FOR THOSE WHO PLAY:[/h1]
PAYDAY: The Heist
Killing Floor

[h1]NOTES:[/h1]
- There is a sequal to this game (Left 4 Dead 2).
- Left 4 Dead 2 features every campaign from this game.
- There are not a lot of players online

Left4Dead ist ein sehr gutes Spiel. 
Anf√§nglich war ich sehr skeptisch wie es als Einzelspieler mit 3 Computergesteuerten Mitspielern funktioniert. 
Aber schon nach den ersten 10 Minuten im Spiel war ein gewisser Suchtfaktor vorhanden.
Auf jeden Fall ne Kaufempfehlung

Left 4 Dead ist genau das was man sich vorstellt, wenn man "First-Person-Coop-Survival-Zombie-Shooter" h√∂rt :D

Ziel des Kampange-Modus ist es gemeinsam mit 3 weiteren Mitspielern (oder Bots) das Safehouse zu erreichen. von dort geht es dann weiter zum n√§chsten, zwischendruch Horden von Zombies die darauf warten euch Lebendig zu Fressen. Klingt eigentlich langweilig ist es aber nicht. 
Jede einzelne Kampange ist eine gute Story verpackt und motiviert die Spieler das Ziel zu erreichen. so Startet man zum Beispiel in einem zerfallenen Flughafen voller Zombies k√§mpft sich durch die Kellergew√∂lbe um letztlich auf die Rollbahn zu gelangen und einen SOS-Funkspruch senden zu k√∂nnen. danach hei√üt es warten bis der Helikopter kommt und so lange √úberleben.
Doch was w√§re ein Zombie-Shooter ohne besondere Mutanten? Left 4 Dead l√§sst auch hier nicht auf sich warten: eine Hand voll Speziell infizierte Zombies machen euch an bestimmten stellen im Spiel das leben schwer. wer hier auf einzelk√§mpfer macht hat schon so gut wie verloren.

Left 4 Dead macht besonders mit Freunden so richtig Spa√ü wurde aber mittlerweile von Left 4 Dead 2 √ºberholt.
[b]Wer noch keines der Beiden Spiele Hat dem ist Klar Left 4 Dead 2 zu empfehlen, da dort auch die Maps aus L4D1 zu finden sind[/b] + neue mutanten + neue (melee-)Waffen.

It's really fun, but it focused more on action than terror and there are a few glitches with the graphics. For example, at the beginning of the No Mercy episode where the helicopter is flying around looking for survivors, the searchlight was black instead of white and when a gas station exploded, it kept showing black fire instead of orange fire. It feels more like an arcade game than a game with a storyline. It's best played with your friends online. All you do is shoot a large number of zombies. Repetitive, but fun.

FINAL RATING: 82 out of 100

I have been playing this game since either 2008 or 2009 on Xbox 360 and, like Left 4 Dead 2, this game is amazing. Although there aren't as many weapons compared to the second game, that doesn't mean the game isn't fun and shouldn't be played. My only problems with Left 4 Dead 1 are that the versus scoring system is kinda poo and the game is full of teamkillers. Other than those issues, this game is amazing, and I would recommend it to people who don't get bored easily.

Left 4 Dead is one of my favourite kick back and kill zombie games.

The campaigns are:
No Mercy
Death Toll
Dead Air
Blood Harvest

DLC Campaigns: Crash Course. The Sacrifice.

The campaigns are fun but rather limited, though with a shadow AI the zombies aren't always in the same place.
The enemies vary each time. You have special infected such as;
Tank: Big guy (on steroids at least) is the hardest one to down. Take him down before he takes you down.
Boomer: Big ugly pus filled infected. Pukes on you which covers your vision. His boomer bile also attracts the horde.
Smoker: Long range enemy. Will grab you with his tongue and choke you.
Hunter: Close range, jumps on you, leaving you helpless until a team mate shoves him off.
Witch: The witch will be sat on the floor crying, if you get near her she will stand up and growl. Annoy her and she will come after you. She will knock you down in one hit so it is best to avoid her or just shoot the living crap out of her before she can hit you.

The campaigns are basically short movies. You hit a safe room between each chapter. Make sure you pick up a med kit, heal and grab ammo. Guns are limited. You have a machine gun, shot gun and pistols. You can also pick up molotovs and pipe bombs. There are four or five chapters in each campaign, with the last chapter classed as a finale. You cannot avoid the masses of infected that come to get you whilst you wait for the rescue to arrive. Usually after the second tank appears and is killed, the rescue vehicle arrives. Always make sure you are near where the vehicle will stop as literally hundreds of enemies will appear making it difficult to get to the vehicle. Pistols are handy to carry as they have infinite ammo. 

Achievements on this game are pretty easy to pick up aside from a few. If you have three awesome friends who will have your back then you should 100% this game easily, if not then good luck to you!!

9.5/10. 

Happy Hunting!!

Generally I dont like games where character progression resets after every scenario you play through. 
I know it's supposed to be a part of the gameplay but i wish the scenarios could connect and there was more of a rpg element in games like this.

But with that said - don't count this old game out. Even in 2015, With a friend, it's really fun. It has fast paced gameplay, Zombies are fast and hordes are devestating. A car alarm can really be the one thing killing your team no matter how good you are. The gameplay is varied enough to keep you playing. Throw a gas tank, blow it up with your sniperrifle, sneak past hordes (if you want).

On the negative side it lacks guns, only two tiers and no real variation between them (and with every new scenario you start over from zero). And almost no melee weapons :(. 

The bosses are pretty much the same at every map, but if you made it that far you wont care, you just want to survive that last wave...


With the right friend you will have a good time. Me and my friend have played most Zombie games out there and we are having a blast!
Verry Dynamic. No time to waste. Much dead. Such fun.

Left 4 Dead is a co-op, first-person shooter video game, with survival horror elements thrown into the mix. Just like Castle Crashers, this game is for that special friendship group, composed of four friends. With this game, you will find a bounty of endless fun, especially when setting the game's difficulty to an all-time high, as it really gives you that experience of being an endangered species, with the more stronger zombies wanting you dead, thus extinct. From my point of view, you can already tell I hold this game in high regard. Probably due to the fact it [i]is[/i] developed by Valve.

The story takes place in an unamed location, within Pennsylvania. A highly contagious virus known as th ''Green Flu'' swarms the state, causing heavy mutation to human body cells and brain functions, resulting in the loss of humanity, meaning yes, the birth of zombies. 

Two weeks after the infectious outbreak, four survivors, William ''Bill'' Overbeck, a bold, Vietnam veteran; Zoey, a sassy college student; Louis, an optimistic IT technician, and Francis, an aggressive outlaw biker, the four heroes of this game make their way through perilous cities, discovering along the way that the virus is causing more dangerous mutations. On a side note, the story of this game is split into campaigns, going in chronological order from top to bottom and progressively, the story is carried out on to the games sequel.

The player takes control of one of the four survivors; only if human players are not involved, thus the survivors are controlled by the CPU. The main objection of the game is to reach the safehouse after each level of the campaign. 

Beware to watch out for the special infected. These types of zombies are the strongest of the common infected and if you get incapitated by one, you won't be able to shake them off, but unless one of your fellow survivors lends a helping hand and kills the attacking zombie. So, this just goes to show that teamwork in this game is the key of getting farther and staying progressively stable to continue playing.

Guns and other types of defense and weaponry, (in the shapes of molotovs and first-aid kits) are scattered among the map, usually on different occasions. This mainly happens after holding off an entire zombie horde, where they break through from left, right and centre. All of these weapons that you find are frequently random, but you can stick to the weapon you like the most. Just make sure to search for ammo at a seldom pace, especially if you're playing on a much higher difficulty. When outnumbered, just remember to always keep your health up, along with your teammates, as every chip of HP is precious into reaching the end of your goals.

This game is simply fantastic, but is usually overshadowed by its sequel, Left 4 Dead 2; possibly due to the inclusion of all campaigns found in this one and carried out in its said sequel. The one thing I personally prefer from this game is the feel of the slightly tighter controls it has when compared to Left 4 Dead 2. I would say this one is for the competitive players and the sequel is for the casual players. Considering you could just mess around, with the Shrek mod and all, and don't tell me you bloody haven't. It's a lot of fun and of course, the modding community adds to Left 4 Dead 2's advantage, much to this games' disadvantage.

In closing, I definitely recommend this game to all who are fans of survival horror video games and those itching to test their own determination and teamwork with one another. If you have have the sequel, I would still recommend getting this first game, just for its originality and or the fact you can add it to your godly Valve collection.
